I was wondering what everyone's favorite album would be. Any genre works. Any album works (includes soundtracks and compelation albums.) If you made a list of your favorite albums, which would be your number 1 choice? If you have a why, that works also. I'm not looking for a profeshinal answer here. I'm looking for a personal answer.
 
 
 My Number 1 choice would be Bob Seger and the Silver Bullet Band's Like A Rock.

George Strait - Carrying Your Love With Me
 
 And yet again I had to pick one. So hard to do. I have this one and two others I could wear out listening too over and over.

Division Bell by Pink Floyd.
 
 
 No wait.......
 
 
 The Wall by Pink Floyd.
 
 
 Wait! Wait!
 
 
 Animals by Pink Floyd.
 
 
 I take that back.......
 
 
 Momentary Lapse of Reason by Pink Floyd.
 
 
 Hmmmmm....forget all that. Yeah, I have decided.
 
 
 Division Bell by Pink Floyd.
 
 
 No wait................................................emoticon_cry

Tell you all what, let's go ahead and make it your top 2 or 3 favorite albums.
 
 I already said what my favorite album is. My second favorte album would be 
 Bruce Springsteen's Born In The U.S.A. I love the songs "No Surrender" and "I'm Goin' Down".
 
 I would say that my third favorite album would be
 Boston's Corporate America. This one is a little more personal for me. It's kind of a cheesy personal choice but a little personal none the less. I love the song "I Had A Good Time." But beyond that, I became a Boston fan while I was in High School. The album came out the year I graduated high school. Okay, it didn't really come out until the November after I graduated but it was the same calender year.

See it is hard to just name one. Wait.....is this a thread about Lay's chips or music? I forget.
 
 My other two are:
 Carole King -Tapestry
 Garth Brooks - Sevens

I can't put these in order because I love them all but...
 DMB-Busted Stuff
 The John Butler Trio-Sunrise Over Sea
 The Wallflowers-Rebel, Sweetheart
 Carl Orff-Carmina Burana

There is a similar thread to this and here were my answers there for a top ten: http://4forums.com/political/showthread.php?t=4687 Post #8
 
 It is very, very hard for me to pick just one though.
 
 At the moment I'm loving Carbon Leaf's "Indian Summer" and "Take 5 Alive" albums. They're fantastic. Best new music I've heard in a long time.
